text: Melvin Leon "Mel" Stottlemyre Sr. (November 13, 1941 â€“ January 13, 2019) was an American professional baseball pitcher and pitching coach. He was born in Hazleton, Missouri. He played for 11 seasons in Major League Baseball for the New York Yankees, and coached for 23 seasons. He was a five-time MLB All-Star and five-time World Series champion, as a coach. Stottlemyre coached for the New York Mets, Houston Astros, New York Yankees and the Seattle Mariners. Stottlemyre died on January 13, 2019 from multiple myeloma in Seattle, Washington, aged 77.Mel Stottlemyre, New York baseball legend, dead at 77 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1941 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple myeloma Category:American philanthropists Category:New York Yankees players Category:Sportspeople from Missouri
